name: Use AWS WAF Web ACL for Application Load Balancers
description: Ensure that all Application Load Balancers (ALBs) have an AWS WAF Web ACL attached to protect against common web exploits and malicious traffic patterns.

name: Enable Access Logging for Elastic Load Balancers
description: Enable access logging for all Elastic Load Balancers (Application, Network, and Gateway) to capture detailed information about requests sent to the load balancer. Configure logs to be stored in a dedicated S3 bucket with appropriate access controls and encryption.

name: Configure Application Load Balancers with Strictest Desync Mitigation Mode
description: Configure all Application Load Balancers with the strictest desync mitigation mode to protect against desync attacks. If the strictest mode is not feasible, ensure that at least the 'defensive' mode is configured and the 'drop_invalid_header_fields' attribute is enabled.

name: Deploy Elastic Load Balancers Across Multiple Availability Zones
description: Ensure that all Elastic Load Balancers (Application, Network, and Gateway) are configured to operate across at least two Availability Zones (AZs) to maintain high availability and fault tolerance in case of an AZ failure.

name: Use Secure TLS Configuration for Load Balancer Listeners
description: Configure all HTTPS listeners on Elastic Load Balancers to use only secure TLS protocols (TLS 1.2 or higher) and strong cipher suites. Regularly review and update the security policy to align with the latest security best practices.

name: Enable Deletion Protection for Elastic Load Balancers
description: Enable deletion protection for all Elastic Load Balancers to prevent accidental deletion of critical load balancer resources.

name: Configure HTTPS Listeners for Application Load Balancers
description: Ensure that all Application Load Balancers use HTTPS listeners with valid SSL/TLS certificates. Configure HTTP to HTTPS redirection for any HTTP listeners to enforce encrypted communication.

name: Use AWS Certificate Manager for Load Balancer SSL/TLS Certificates
description: Use SSL/TLS certificates provided by AWS Certificate Manager (ACM) for all HTTPS listeners on Elastic Load Balancers. ACM simplifies certificate management and ensures automatic renewal of certificates.

name: Enable Cross-Zone Load Balancing for Network and Gateway Load Balancers
description: Enable cross-zone load balancing for Network and Gateway Load Balancers to ensure even distribution of traffic across all registered targets in all enabled Availability Zones.

name: Configure Health Checks for Load Balancer Target Groups
description: Configure appropriate health checks for all target groups associated with Elastic Load Balancers. Ensure that health check protocols, ports, and paths are correctly set to accurately determine the health of backend targets.

name: Implement Secure Listener Rules for Application Load Balancers
description: Configure secure listener rules for Application Load Balancers to control traffic routing based on request attributes. Implement rules to block or redirect potentially malicious requests and enforce security policies.

name: Use VPC Security Groups to Control Traffic to Load Balancers
description: Assign appropriate VPC security groups to Elastic Load Balancers to control inbound and outbound traffic. Configure security group rules to allow only necessary traffic and follow the principle of least privilege.
